fields.description: When testing with 999 volumes, not a problem, but 3600 volumes uncovered an issue. After describing volumes, we request snapshots passing filter values for ALL volume ids. That becomes too much and the server responds 404: unknown. [~sjones] is there a EUCA ticket that needs to be written as well? Sounds like 2 problems, better error from back end and better handling of large number of volumes on console.
fields.summary: Large number of volumes breaks volumes landing page

comments.body: [~dkavanagh], the 404 response is likely due to EUCA-5918.
Note that AWS/EC2 probably fails such a request with a FilterLimitExceeded error and we may do the same in the future (with default limits being AWS compatible)
Perhaps the simplest solution to fix this would be to not filter by volume ids when fetching the snapshots if the number of volumes exceeds a given threshold (> 999?).
[~scottb], [~tvo], this issue should be marked as a KI in 4.2
EUCA-5918 is being worked on currently so the service behaviour may still change in 4.2.

Capturing notes from arch meeting...
- There is a limit of 5,000 volumes and 10,000 snapshots per account.
- The filter list limit is 1,000 items

Note: We should avoid passing the filtered list of volume IDs to the conn.get_all_snapshots() call if there are more than 1,000 volumes on the landing page.
[~jloza]: I am kicking this back to you since I don't think I should be assigned a GUI ticket. But the ticket did make it in to the Release Notes for 4.2.

I added 100 volumes at a time and was able to have over 1000 volumes displaying properly on the landing page. I'm going to set a limit of 1000 for the purposes of this fix as that seems reasonable.

fix branch created.
need to see if we can test larger volume counts on AWS

Verified.  I was able to view 3600 volumes.  As I scrolled down I could see more volumes in 100 increments.
